cards.rules_text:
[+1]: You may discard a card or sacrifice an artifact. When you do, draw a card.
[-3]: Destroy target artifact or creature. Create a Treasure token.
[-5]: Put target artifact or creature card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control. When you do, create a token that's a copy of it, except has haste. Exile the token at the beginning of the next end step.
cards.special_text:
[+1]: You may discard a card or sacrifice an artifact. When you do, draw a card.
[-3]: Destroy target artifact or creature. Create a Treasure token.
[-5]: Put target artifact or creature card from a graveyard onto the battlefield under your control. When you do, create a token that's a copy of it, except has haste. Exile the token at the beginning of the next end step.

cards.rules_text:
Whenever another creature with haste or flash enters the battlefield under your control, put a cardio counter on The Best Bout Machine.
Whenever The Best Bout Machine attacks, you draw X cards and each opponent loses X life, where X is the number of cardio counters on The Best Bout Machine.
Permanents being put into a graveyard from the battlefield don't cause abilities to trigger.

cards.rules_text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{T}: Add one mana of any color. Spend this mana only to cast an Interstellar spell.

{T}, Sacrifice Command Center: Search your library for a basic land card, put it onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle.
When Command Center is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, you may pay {2}. If you do, create a Treasure token. [i](It's an artifact with “{T}, Sacrifice this token: Add one mana of any color.”)[/i]

{W}{U} REMODULATE You've beeped your last boop, cowboy. Slowly accrue counters as your creatures die.
{U}{B} REMODULATE Attack aggressively and recycle the parts of your brave cannon fodder for later.
{B}{R} INTERSTELLAR GRIND Open a wormhole into a reality where death and discard hurts you less than them.
{R}{G} SPACEWAR RAMP Go big or go into space. Or do both.
{G}{W} COUNTERS Build up your creatures with additional counters.
{W}{B} INTERSTELLAR CONTROL Take control of the cosmos with interstellar wormholes. And guns.
{B}{G} SACRIFICE There are always more robots.
{G}{U} SPACEWAR AGGRO Apply pressure to your opponent with strong creatures, disrupting their plans with phenomena.
{U}{R} SPACEWAR SPELLS Throw spells, phenomena, and alien goo at your opponent.
{R}{W} INTERSTELLAR AGGRO Disrupt your foe with early spells and close the door quickly with creatures pouring out of wormholes.
Non-Robot creatures have base power and toughness 1/1.
cards.flavor_text: [i]Laser times make laser men. Laser men make laser times.[/i]

cards.rules_text: Moss-Covered Three-Handled Family Killbot enters the battlefield tapped with a stun counter on it. [i](If a permanent with a stun counter would become untapped, remove one from it instead.)[/i]

cards.flavor_text: [i]“Gonna need you to go ahead and put your clothes back on, Flash.”[/i]

cards.rules_text: Exile target artifact or creature.
cards.flavor_text:

“But he's such a little guy.”[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Trample, ward {4}, haste
Whenever The Hammer Slammer attacks, defending player may sacrifice a permanent with mana value equal to or greater than The Hammer Slammer's power. If they do, put a +1/+1 counter on The Hammer Slammer and remove it from combat.

If one or more +1/+1 counters would be put on a creature you control, that many counters plus an addition counter of your choice from among +1/+1, flying, vigilance, or lifelink are put on it instead.
cards.flavor_text: [i]Pulling apart and rebuilding each other is a rite of passage among robots, but it makes meeting biological species awkward.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Artifacts you control have deathtouch.
Whenever a nonartifact creature dies, create a 1/1 black and red Robot artifact creature token with “This creature can't block.”
cards.flavor_text: [i]Part soldier. Part tank. Part coffee machine. 107% lethal.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Robots and Vehicles you control have lifelink.
Whenever you gain life, put a +1/+1 counter on The Motorgeist.
cards.flavor_text: [i]Ten thousand pounds of mechanical undeath, bristling with cosmic hunger, seeks long-term romantic connection.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Supermandroid enters the battlefield with a flying counter on it.
Remodulate 1 [i](This enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it. When it dies, put its counters on another creature you control.)[/i]
Surveil 2. [i](Look at the top two cards of your library, then put any number of them into your graveyard and the rest on top of your library in any order.)[/i]
cards.flavor_text: [i]“Travel the universe, Flash. See the sights, Flash. I'm lucky if I get to leave the starport sometimes.”[/i]

cards.rules_text: When you encounter The Crescendo of Primordial Gods, exile up to two target nonland permanents, then return those to the battlefield under their owners' control at the beginning of the next end step.
When you encounter Engage the Hyperdrive Portal, exile any number of target cards from a single graveyard.
When you encounter The Galactic Eye, target player mills seven cards.
When you encounter Arrival of the Drilldozer, exile up to one target noncreature artifact or noncreature enchantment.
When you encounter Inside the Chromium Domium, draw three cards, then put two cards from your hand on top of your library in any order.
When you encounter Careening through Known Space, create a token that's a copy of target artifact you control.

cards.card_name: Frozen Alive on the Ice Planet
cards.rules_text: When you encounter Frozen Alive on the Ice Planet, each player chooses a creature they control. Until your next turn, creatures not chosen this way can't attack or block.
When you encounter Witness the Cosmic Baby, up to one target creature has base power and toughness 5/5 until your next turn.

cards.card_name: Behold the Secrets of Ancient Genes
cards.rules_text: When you encounter Behold the Secrets of Ancient Genes, put a genome counter on any number of target creatures. Those creatures gain all creature types. Then draw a card.
When you encounter Nap the Infinite Nap, return up to one target nonland permanent to its owner's hand.
When you encounter Another Cosmonaut Lost in Space, you may sacrifice an artifact or creature. When you do, draw two cards.
When you encounter Embiggening Ray Malfunction, you may have target creature you control deal damage equal to its power to target creature you don't control.
When you encounter Migration of the Shuttlebirds, it deals 3 damage to target creature an opponent controls. If that creature would die this turn, exile it instead.
When you encounter Summon the Ghostronaut, create a 0/0 white Spirit Ranger creature token, then put a +1/+1 counter on it for each artifact you control.
When you encounter Engage the Particle Collidoscope, create two Treasure tokens. [i](They're artifacts with “{T}, Sacrifice this token: Add one mana of any color.”)[/i]
When you encounter The Cycle of Cosmic Rebirth, you may discard up to three cards. When you do, draw that many cards.

cards.card_name: Prepare to Traverse the Infinite Void
cards.rules_text: When you encounter Prepare to Traverse the Infinite Void, put a flying counter on each of up to two target creatures.

When you encounter Marooned on the Main Moon, destroy up to one target land. When you do, its controller may search their library for a basic land card, put it onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle.

cards.card_name: A Crash Course in Brain Surgery
cards.rules_text: When you encounter A Crash Course in Brain Surgery, each opponent discards a card, then each opponent who didn't discard a nonland card this way loses 3 life.

When you encounter Unravel Some Vast Conspiracy, exile the top card of each player's library. Until the end of your next turn, you may play one of those cards, and mana of any type can be spent to cast it.
When you encounter A Refreshing Change of Pace, untap all nonland permanents you control.
When you encounter Invasion of the Robotrons, create a 2/2 colorless Robot artifact creature token.

cards.card_name: Gamma-Laser Space Beams from the Sky
cards.rules_text: When you encounter Gamma-Laser Space Beams from the Sky, create three tapped 1/1 black Alien creature tokens.
When you encounter Experience Tetrahedal Fold-Space, double up to one target creature's power until end of turn.

cards.card_name: A Slow Dance in the Gravity Well
cards.rules_text: When you encounter A Slow Dance in the Gravity Well, tap target nonland permanent you don't control and put a stun counter on it. [i](If a permanent with a stun counter would become untapped, remove one from it instead.)[/i]
When you encounter Ironblood's Pleasure Lounge, it deals 3 damage to each opponent.
When you encounter The Retrovortex Beckons, each opponent puts a card from their hand on top of their library.
When you encounter The Impossibility of Time Itself, return up to one target permanent card from your graveyard to your hand.
When you encounter A Blue Steel Metropolis, put a +1/+1 counter on each creature you control.
This creature can't block.

Astral Phenomenon enters the battlefield tapped unless you control an artifact.

cards.flavor_text: [i]No one knows who built the robotrons originally, but their schematics are public domain.[/i]

cards.flavor_text: [i]Deep in the bowels of the buggular homeworld, all of the senses will experience things beyond the range of human ability.[/i]

cards.flavor_text: [i]Fobos, capital of the Fobos system, home of the Fobosians—a highly imaginative empire.[/i]

cards.flavor_text: [i]Gulgops, head of the Galactic Federation, is a being so ancient—or inattentive—that even he has forgotten his original homeworld.[/i]

cards.rules_text:

cards.flavor_text: [i]Klaxular, home of creatures beyond human understanding, although most humans don't understand much.[/i]

cards.flavor_text: [i]The many-limbed blorbaxians craft architectural wonders showcasing their dexterity, with practicality rarely a concern.[/i]

cards.flavor_text: [i]Uncharted space is dotted with rogue space stations where renegade chemtyrants and biovillains invent the galaxy's next problem.[/i]

cards.rules_text:

{T}: Add {W} or {B}.
cards.flavor_text: [i]Drifting between dying stars, the rotting hulks of starships and space stations are eternal testament to the folly of repealing the Federation's pilot exams.[/i]

cards.rules_text:

{T}: Add {B} or {R}.
cards.flavor_text: [i]Gyblax is a rugged world of adventure and derring-do, ironically peopled with the galaxy's most timid civilization.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Uncaring Sun enters the battlefield tapped unless you control an artifact.
{T}: Add {G} or {W}.
cards.flavor_text: [i]The Galactic Federation, a bureaucratic maze of meaningless votes, exists as a cosmic balance to stop the universe expanding too much.[/i]

To play the constructed Spacewar! variant, begin the game with at least ten phenomenon unique cards in your cosmic deck.
Each player has their own cosmic deck.
Cards are encountered only when instructed to by Spacewar! effects and are shuffled back into the deck after resolving.

Whenever a creature you control dies, you lose 1 life, then spacewar! [i](Encounter the top card of your cosmic deck.)[/i]

Creatures your opponents control are colorless Treasure artifacts with “{T}, Sacrifice this artifact: Add one mana of any color,” and lose all other types and abilities.

To play the limited Spacewar! variant, begin the game with at least five phenomenon cards in your cosmic deck. Duplicate phenomena are allowed.
Each player has their own cosmic deck.
Cards are encountered only when instructed to by Spacewar! effects and are shuffled back into the deck after resolving.
As long as Quarth, Academic Fraud is tapped, if an opponent would draw a card except the first one they draw in each of their draw steps instead that player skips that draw and you draw a card.
